claim: Specific near‑term technical milestones are plausible: 2025 will see AI agents performing real cognitive work and transforming software development, 2026 will likely produce systems that can generate novel scientific insights, and 2027 may bring robots capable of real‑world tasks, with much larger societal changes unfolding through the 2030s.
explanation: Plausible but partly optimistic. Agentic AIs are already doing substantial cognitive work in software development today (measured productivity gains from GitHub Copilot and multi‑agent/code‑automation research), so 2025 seeing agents reshape development is well supported. ([arxiv.org](https://arxiv.org/abs/2302.06590?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [github.blog](https://github.blog/2023-06-27-the-economic-impact-of-the-ai-powered-developer-lifecycle-and-lessons-from-github-copilot/?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) AI has already produced novel scientific advances (AlphaFold, ML‑discovered antibiotics) and LLMs have generated lab‑validated hypotheses, so 2026 producing more AI‑driven scientific insights is credible though usually requiring human validation and robust workflows. ([pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC8349178/?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [arxiv.org](https://arxiv.org/abs/2405.12258?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) Humanoid/general‑purpose robots performing a wide range of reliable real‑world tasks by 2027 is much more uncertain: industry claims (e.g., Tesla Optimus) are optimistic, while robotics experts point to persistent hardware, dexterity, energy and robustness gaps. ([cnbc.com](https://www.cnbc.com/2025/04/23/elon-musk-on-robotaxi-optimus-tariffs-energy-and-teslas-future.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [technologyreview.com](https://www.technologyreview.com/2024/08/27/1103035/a-skeptics-guide-to-humanoid-robot-videos/?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) Broad societal and economic shifts by the 2030s are widely projected (e.g., McKinsey/PwC economic impact studies), but magnitude/timing depend on deployment, regulation, and integration challenges. ([mckinsey.org](https://www.mckinsey.org/mgi/overview/in-the-news/ai-could-increase-corporate-profits-by-4-trillion-a-year-according-to-new-research?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) Overall score reflects strong evidence for near‑term software and research impacts, sizable uncertainty for robotics timelines, and conditional but likely societal change in the 2030s.
